humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the pathology report, there are 4 lymph nodes examined, and 2 of them are positive for metastatic carcinoma (N1). The modified Rule 6, Rule 8, and New Rule 10-12 apply here. The report mentions 'pN1' which also supports the N1 stage. Extracapsular extension is identified in one of the lymph nodes, but it does not affect the N stage in this case.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for this patient is N1 because metastatic carcinoma involves 1 out of 2 examined lymph nodes (pN1) as mentioned in Part 2 and Part 5 of the report. Additionally, extracapsular extension is identified in one of the involved lymph nodes (ECE+). The total number of examined lymph nodes is 4, and 2 of them have metastatic carcinoma (2/4 = 0.5, rounded up to 1 for the pN1 category). The substaging information (e.g., N1mi, N1a, N1b, or N1c) is not provided, so only the main N stage category should be determined.
